newsitem.title: USA: Computer Assocs merger seen dilutive - analyst.
newsitem.headline: Computer Assocs merger seen dilutive - analyst.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc's assertion that its $1.2 billion Cheyenne Software Inc merger would have no impact on earnings was greeted with doubt by at least one Wall Street analyst.

Doug Crook, an enterprise software analyst at Montgomery Securities, took issue with CA chairman Charles Wang's assertion in a conference call Monday afternoon that the acquisition would have a "flat" impact on earnings.
The analyst said that with only $200 million in cash on hand at last count, CA will have to fund around $1 billion of the total $1.2 billion purchase price through new debt.
"I think (the merger) is going to add another $50 million in interest expense," Crook said. "I don't see how it cannot be dilutive."

Furthermore, Crook noted that with Cheyenne, Computer Associates is acquiring a company with lower profit margins. He estimated that Cheyenne's margins were about 25 percent versus the 35 percent produced by Computer Associates.
"With the combination of the two, I think there's some dilutiton there," he argued.
Crook said he believes Computer Associates long-term prospects remain excellent, but that he expects Computer Associates share price gains to be dampened in the short-term.
Crook maintains a buy rating on the stock.
Montgomery Securities does not distinguish between near-term and long-term ratings as some brokerages do.
"It's a complimentary acquisition, no doubt," Crook said, but added that, "I think it is going to take some wind out the near-term potential of the stock," he said.
In response to an analysts' question, Wang said he expected "flat" effect on earnigs one year out, excluding an unspecified one-time charge for the costs of the acquisition.

Despite these lingering doubts, the stock gained steam following the conference call, rising by as much as 1-1/2 points on the day in afternoon trading, after lingering in negative territory during much of the morning.
